meanings.sent1: The gravitative force pulled the objects downward.
meanings.sent2: The planets in our solar system experience gravitative effects.
meanings.sent3: The gravitative pull of the moon made the tides dance.
meanings.sent4: Her gravitative presence in the room was undeniable.
meanings.sent5: The gravitative nature of black holes is fascinating to scientists.

meanings.definition: Having the quality of attracting objects toward a center of mass.
meanings.sent1: The gravitative field around the magnet was strong.
meanings.sent2: The sun's gravitative pull keeps the planets in orbit.
meanings.sent3: The gravitative charm of the black hole was irresistible.
meanings.sent4: His gravitative personality drew people towards him effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The gravitative force of the blacksmith's hammer shaped the metal.

meanings.definition: Tending to move or be drawn toward a center of mass.
meanings.sent1: The gravitative nature of the ball made it roll downhill.
meanings.sent2: Objects in space exhibit gravitative tendencies towards larger bodies.
meanings.sent3: The gravitative cupcakes on the table seemed to call out to me.
meanings.sent4: Her gravitative gaze locked onto the distant horizon.
meanings.sent5: The gravitative pull of the black hole was inescapable.
